item.title: Reticulate and Computational Genomics Blog
item.description: FUN WITH RETICULATE: The reticulate package lets R and Python work together! I tested this out with a few codes below. Continue reading for a more detailed explanation on how this works. library(reticulate) Sys.setenv(RETICULATE_PYTHON="/usr/bin/python") use_python("/usr/bin/python") #Python code chunk x="Magic" y="Abracadabra" print("R and Python are cool!") ## R and Python are cool! #R code chunk library(reticulate) py$x ## [1] "Magic" py$y ## [1] "Abracadabra" You can assign something to an R code chunk like “hello“ and save it as “hi” then in python you can also assign something like “world” and also save it as “hi”.
